titles.title: Sudden Unexpected Death Data Enhancement and Awareness Act
Sudden Unexpected Death Data Enhancement and Awareness Act

Sudden Unexpected Death Data Enhancement and Awareness Act
Sudden Unexpected Death Data Enhancement and Awareness Act
To amend the Public Health Service Act to improve the health of children and help better understand and enhance awareness about unexpected sudden death in early life.
A bill to improve the health of children and help better understand and enhance awareness about unexpected sudden death in early life.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 417.

action.text: Mr. Burgess moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 669.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

calendar.text: Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Senate Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment and an amendment to the Title by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Bilirakis asked unanimous consent to take from the Speaker's table and agree to the Senate amendments.

vote.text: On motion that the House agree to the Senate amendments Agreed to without objection.

committee.name: Senate Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

term.name: Emergency medical services and trauma care
Social work, volunteer service, charitable organizations

bill.summary: 11/20/2014--Passed Senate amended. Sudden Unexpected Death Data Enhancement and Awareness Act - (Sec. 2) Requires the Secretary of Health and Human Services (HHS) to continue and report on activities related to stillbirth, sudden unexpected infant death, and sudden unexplained death in childhood, including collaborating with states and experts to improve the quality and consistency of data collected after one of these deaths.
